TopicTitle: [1.2.2] Stock Part Revamp, Update 1.9.6. Released Source Files!

Articles.Content: It's worse than that. The merge function gives the option to Merge only if there are no conflicts, or "Keep Newer" if there are. "Keep Newer" always puts in whatever's in the folder you're copying, even if the file it's replacing has been modified more recently.

I still run Snow Leopard and I can confirm that you'll have to manually merge the folders. At least I've never found any setting to allow proper merging. It wasn't too much of a bother, really, though I didn't use every revamped part. Just make sure you've got a backup for your Squad/Parts folder.

Hey Ven, don't know if you manually coded that MM file or not but I greatly appreciate your nice organized style. I don't even know what coding language that was and I was still able to get in and pop out the bits I needed to remove.

Favorite design is one I don't think I've seen you show off on here, but the redo of the Clamp-O-Tron Jr. is easily the best redesign in the pack, it just looks exactly like where you'd hook up a pipe to refuel a tank. Well done!

I still run Snow Leopard and I can confirm that you'll have to manually merge the folders. At least I've never found any setting to allow proper merging. It wasn't too much of a bother, really, though I didn't use every revamped part. Just make sure you've got a backup for your Squad/Parts folder.

Yeah this is the first really annoying thing with my mac i've encountered. Curious though (I know nooooob question) but how did you manually merge, I tried that but I must have done it wrong.

By hand.

In other words, the old-fashioned delve into the folders and copy-and-paste.
haha alright i'll see what i can't do

It's worse than that. The merge function gives the option to Merge only if there are no conflicts, or "Keep Newer" if there are. "Keep Newer" always puts in whatever's in the folder you're copying, even if the file it's replacing has been modified more recently.

Weird. I merge folders in the Finder all the time and have never had an issue. That said you could use ditto to merge folders pretty easily

  • Open the Terminal
  • Type 'ditto' followed by a space
  • Drag the source folder to the Terminal window.
  • Drag the destination folder (GameData) to the Terminal window
  • Hit return.

Yeah this is the first really annoying thing with my mac i've encountered. Curious though (I know nooooob question) but how did you manually merge, I tried that but I must have done it wrong.

The easiest way for me to do it was to have two Finder windows open. Have the revamp folder on one side, the stock folder on the other. Start with Squad/Parts/Engines for example. Then open a specific engine folder, engineJetBasic, for example. Copy everything within the Ven engineJetBasic folder and paste it into the Squad version of that folder.

It'll bring up the dialog menu to Replace/Replace All/Cancel. Click Replace All and it'll replace the stock models & textures while leaving the stock configs.

It's a bit of a chore, but I don't know of any way around it. And at least you have firm control over which parts you replace the textures for.

Also, I find that when you've finished merging a particular folder, it helps to quickly right-click the folder and change the label color, so you know that you're done with it.

My game won't load the SXTnerva part. It doesn't freeze, but it just won't load that part.

I've run into this before with model nodes. For some reason the game doesn't recognuze certain placeholder textures as valid and won't load them. Dig through the rest of SXT and swap in another MBM with a different file size, changing the name to match the files you're replacing.
